sense.name: a measurement of weight
sense.examples: John gained ten pounds over the holidays. Marathon runners can lose pounds during a 26-mile race. I bought a ten-pound bag of flour.

sense.name: a measure of force
sense.examples: This recipe says to have the pressure cooker at twelve pounds of pressure. A filled scuba tank has about 3000 pounds per square inch of pressure.

sense.name: unit of currency, e.g., British, Egyptian
sense.examples: An Egyptian pound is worth about 6 euros. It cost twelve British pounds sterling. 100 piasters make up a Lebanese pound. We changed our pounds to euros at a bank.

sense.name: a public enclosure for animals, as dogs
sense.examples: We picked Fido up at the pound. This domestic salmon was raised in a fish pound. Dogs without current licenses will be taken to the pound.

sense.name: the physical act of striking or hammering
sense.examples: We heard the pound of the surf from our balcony. The fighter couldn't take the pounds from the heavyweight champion. The pound of horses hooves filled the cobblestone streets.
